aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates strong authentication controls with properly protected admin endpoints returning 403 responses. However, the application has significant security header deficiencies across all tested pages, with critical missing protections against clickjacking (X-Frame-Options) and MIME-type sniffing (X-Content-Type-Options). HTTPS is correctly configured, but the absence of security headers like Content-Security-Policy, HSTS, and Permissions-Policy exposes the application to client-side attacks including XSS, clickjacking, and data exfiltration.
recommendations: Immediately add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff and X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN headers to all pages (currently missing on root, /services/send-transport, and /quote pages, and X-Content-Type-Options missing on /admin)
Implement Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header with appropriate max-age value (e.g., 31536000) to enforce HTTPS and prevent downgrade attacks
Deploy Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header with a restrictive policy appropriate for your application to prevent XSS and data exfiltration attacks
Add Referrer-Policy and Permissions-Policy headers across all pages to control referrer information leakage and restrict unnecessary browser APIs
Configure security headers at the web server or application middleware level to ensure consistent enforcement across all endpoints
Conduct a security header audit to verify implementation consistency across production and all staging environments
Consider implementing additional headers like X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies and X-XSS-Protection for defense-in-depth
